item.title: Experimenting with WordVectors and Codenames
item.description: I’ve been playing a lot of Codenames and came across https://jamesmullenbach.github.io/2018/01/02/codenames-fun.html which explored using word2vec to generate clue words. This was really cool! I started wondering if we could use a similar approach to actually play as a spymaster, i.e. answering the question: Given a game board and a side, what should my clue word + targeted number be? This post is a collection of some things I tried and the results.
